ygData.subject: Re: New video card
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes, lacking the agp i will go for the 4. i did see the specs and tests and do know it is coming in at just around the top end of the 2 in performance. since
ygData.messageBody:
Yes, lacking the agp i will go for the 4. i did see the specs and
tests and do know it is coming in at just around the top end of the 2
in performance. since the prices are close, the 4 is good. it is a
little cheesy for them to market this way, but when have they been
any different?

Barto

--- In EverQuest@y..., "J. Smythe" <lgumaer@h...> wrote:
> Thanks for the info. I will just stick with my good ol Geforce 2
MX. I have an AGP slot, but not 300 dollars to spend.
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Thomas H. Comegys
> To: EverQuest@y...
> Sent: Sunday, April 07, 2002 6:53 PM
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] New video card
>
>
> PC Gamer magazine, which regularly reviews hardware items that
are of interest to gamers, like video cards, said that the cheaper
GeForce 4 video cards are basically equivalent or just a little
better than the old GeForce 2 cards. The "real" GeForce 4 cards are
the Ti 4400 and Ti 4600, which cost about $300 and $400,
respectively. It's a marketing gimmick and somewhat underhanded, in
my opinion.
>
> On the other hand, if you do not have an AGP slot, you will be
limited to these less expensive cards. They are not bad video cards
(I am running a GeForce 2 Ultra and it works just fine with EQ), they
are just deceptively named.
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: J. Smythe
> To: EverQuest@y...
> Sent: Sunday, April 07, 2002 6:06 PM
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] New video card
>
>
> Yeah I found out the Geforce 4 is in the low price range,
obviously the new card to get.
>
